title: Installation Error: File does not exist (LOL.OC1.msi.)
body:
Hi league of legends community,

Im in need of great help. Recently, i've bought myself a new PC, once ive downloaded league of legends and try to install the game, an error showed up saying: File does not exist: C:\\Users\user\AppData\Roaming\RiotGames\League of Legends 4.1.2\install\LOL.OC1.msi. Had anyone experience this issue before and got a solution? Much help will be greatly appreciated.

Regards,
Cheunge

replies.body:
Hey there dude,

Could you please try downloading the [Alternative Installation](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BxNnR7I_Zo12UnJUb1FfOUxLbVU/view?usp=sharing) files and following the steps outlined below.

**Instructions:**

* Download Alternate_Installer.zip
* Open Alternate_Installer.zip
* Open C:\
* Drag & drop "Riot Games" folder into C:\
* Go to the "League of Legends" folder
* For easier access, Right-click LeagueClient.exe (do one or more of the following):
  * Create shortcut and drag & drop it to Desktop.
  * Pin to Taskbar
  * Pin to Start Menu
* Double-click LeagueClient.exe.
  * **Note**: Try a few Custom Games to make sure everything is good to go before jumping into a matchmade game.

**Known Issues:**

**Repairing...**

On a re-installation, the launcher will detect that it's missing a lot of files. As such, it'll "repair" the bare minimum components for LCU to properly launch. After that, it should start patching normally.

**System Error**

On a completely fresh OS install, the Alternate Installer will not install third-party dependencies in order for the game client to run. One such dependency is DirectX; have them install it from the Microsoft Website.(edited)
